newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: RUGBY UNION-HART TO GUIDE ALL BLACKS TO WORLD CUP.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-HART TO GUIDE ALL BLACKS TO WORLD CUP.

text.p: John Hart will coach the All Blacks through to their 1999 World Cup campaign, the New Zealand Rugby Football Union (NZRFU) confirmed on Friday.
Hart has been reappointed as coach on a two-year contract which expires on December 31, 1999.

"John is recognised as the best international coach and his long-term appointment to the All Blacks is a key factor in keeping New Zealand at the top of world rugby," NZRFU chief executive David Moffett said.

Hart has coached the All Blacks since the start of the 1996 season. During his tenure the team was won 14 of 15 test matches, become the inaugural Tri-Nations champions, and become the first All Black side to win a test series on South African soil.
Hart said he had thoroughly enjoyed steering the All Blacks into the new professional era and looked forward to the challenges ahead.

"The Rugby World Cup is the long distance goal, but it's much broader than that. We also have the Tri-Nations Series to defend, the Bledisloe Cup to retain, and the ongoing mission of proving ourselves against the Northern Hemisphere countries," he said.
"It's an exciting time for rugby and I am proud to be part of it."
